Articles.Content:
A replica of the [Su-26M](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukhoi_Su-26).

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/gpe1g)

It's not as aerobatic as the real one though, but it's still good. Try flying it without SAS, it actually works pretty well.

[Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/8a36futj38da6ip/Sukhoi%20Su-26.craft?dl=0)
Wow, nice - does the prop turn?
I tried using infernal robotics to make it spin, but the aircraft rolls and makes it unstable.
ah, okay. Still awesome - I was thinking about making a Tu-95 but the number of props scares me....

> 
> ah, okay. Still awesome - I was thinking about making a Tu-95 but the number of props scares me....

Wait Zeke is afraid of part count. Sign of the Apocalypse everyone!

> 
> Wait Zeke is afraid of part count. Sign of the Apocalypse everyone!

Not part count, just the complexity of four sets of contra-rotating propellors....

SOMEONE GO GET JON144!

> 
> Not part count, just the complexity of four sets of contra-rotating propellors....
> SOMEONE GO GET JON144!

If you're afraid of that many props then you really haven't seen the number of stages I use that use a decoupler and rocket engines. I'll give you a hint. It's over 20 engines.
